testCases.explanation: Root=3, left subtree from inorder[9], right subtree from inorder[15,20,7] with preorder [20,15,7]
Root=1, left=2 (inorder left of 1), right=3 (inorder right of 1)
Root=1, left child=2 (2 appears before 1 in inorder)
Root=1, left=2 (leaf), right subtree: preorder [3,4], inorder [3,4] â†’ root=3, right=4. Tree: [1,2,3,null,null,null,4]

description: Given two integer arrays preorder and inorder where preorder is the preorder traversal of a binary tree and inorder is the inorder traversal of the same tree, construct and return the binary tree.

examples.explanation: The root is 3 (first in preorder). In inorder, 9 is to the left of 3, and [15,20,7] are to the right.

constraints: preorder and inorder consist of unique values
Each value of inorder also appears in preorder
preorder is guaranteed to be the preorder traversal of the tree
inorder is guaranteed to be the inorder traversal of the tree
